result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Gutierrez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Gutierrez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse Gutierrez in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 9 months STRAIGHT TIME in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Successfully complete Anger Management counseling.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   No contact with Cesar's.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges, including DNA, 
           or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *   Maintain full-time employment.
     *   Successfully complete 30 hours of community
          service with a non-profit organization.
     *   No firearms; weapons
 Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit, received and filed

Defendant Jesse Gutierrez in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered count dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court granted state's motion for adjournment of sentencing to allow victim to be notified.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Gutierrez in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Jesse Gutierrez in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Jesse Gutierrez in custody.  William Patrick Pipp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge PROTASIEWICZ.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.  Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
